-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

> /kind bug

**What happened**:
When running `kubelet` on a new VM, I get the following error:

    error: failed to run Kubelet: rootDirectory "/var/lib/kubelet" does not exist


**What you expected to happen**:
Previously, if this root directory did not exist, kubelet would automatically create it with the appropriate permissions.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

    $ git clone https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes.git
    $ cd kubernetes
    $ git checkout 039f898c07a643d6ef244fcb65daff5a53de41c8
    $ ./build/run.sh make WHAT=cmd/kubelet
    $ sudo ./_output/dockerized/bin/linux/amd64/kubelet --fail-swap-on=false

This invocation exits immediately with the above error about `/var/lib/kubelet` not existing.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
I believe this recently-merged PR is the cause: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/48487

If I revert this PR's commit locally, and repeat the above steps, then `/var/lib/kubelet` gets automatically created when I start up kubelet:

    $ git revert 6c7245d464250278882b59d68a97b0170201d35d
    $ ./build/run.sh make WHAT=cmd/kubelet
    $ sudo ./_output/dockerized/bin/linux/amd64/kubelet --fail-swap-on=false

This invocation stays running, and if I check in another window, `/var/lib/kubelet` has automatically been created.

This discrepancy is currently breaking our [kubeadm e2e tests](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubeadm/issues/392). If the correct answer is that autocreation of the root directory was never supposed to be a supported feature and just happened to work, then we can update that expectation elsewhere to explicitly create the root directory first, but this does seem like a regression.

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`): upstream/master HEAD (at 039f898c07a643d6ef244fcb65daff5a53de41c8)
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: The same happens on my local desktop and a GCE VM with Ubuntu
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 14.04 on my desktop, 16.04 on GCE
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 4.4.0-83-generic on my desktop, 4.4.0-21-generic on GCE
- Install tools: building/running directly from the source code using the above steps
- Others:
